tn.text: Possible meanings are that they feel guilty for their transgressions and sins or 2) they realize that Yahweh is punishing them for their transgressions and sins. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

"we are rotting away because of them." This phrase compares the way that sin destroys people to the way that flesh rots. AT: "they are destroying us" or "they are killing us." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This implies the people know that God will not forgive them. However, some modern versions translate "because of them."

tn.ref: The righteousness of a righteous person will not save him if he sins!
tn.text: AT: "If righteous people start to sin, the fact that they were righteous before will not save them"

tn.ref: if he trusts in his righteousness
tn.text: "if he depends on his righteousness." The person think that because he was righteous Yahweh will not punish him, even if he sins.

something a person leaves with another person to show that he will keep his promise to pay back what he has borrowed.

tn.text: This is the tenth month of the Hebrew calendar. The fifth day is near the beginning of January on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

Here "our" refers to Ezekiel and the Israelites who have been in Babylon since the time the Babylonians forced King Jehoiachin to leave Jerusalem. AT: "after we became captives" or "after the Babylonians took us as captives to Babylon." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_exclusive]])

tn.ref: a fugitive came to me from Jerusalem
tn.text: "someone escaped from Jerusalem and came to me." The Babylonians had destroyed Jerusalem and killed the people of Jerusalem, but a few people escaped.
AT: "The Babylonians have destroyed the city." The phrase "the city" refers to "Jerusalem." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: The hand of Yahweh had been on me
tn.text: See how you translated "the hand of Yahweh came upon him" in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:01:01|1:3]].
"Dawn" is the time early in the morning when the light of the sun first appears.
AT: "Yahweh opened my mouth." See how you translated "I will open your mouth" in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:03:26|3:27]].
"I was no longer unable to speak" or "I was now able to speak." Ezekiel had been unable to speak anything except prophetic words since [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:03:26|3:26]].
"Yahweh spoke his word." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:01:01|1:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Possible meanings are: "those ruined buildings" or "those ruined cities"
"the land of Israel"

tn.ref: The land has been given to us
tn.text: AT: "Yahweh has given us the land." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
AT: "so that we can possess it" or "as an inheritance." They were implying that since there were so many of them, they should possess it.
Yahweh continues speaking to Ezekiel about the people who were living in the ruins of Israel.

It is implied that they eat blood by eating meat that still has blood in it. Yahweh had commanded them drain out the blood. AT: "You eat meat with blood in it." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: you lift up your eyes towards your idols
tn.text: "you look to your idols." This means "you worship your idols" (UDB). (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]]).
AT: "you pour out blood." This means "you murder people."

tn.ref: Should you really possess the land?
tn.text: Yahweh used this question to rebuke the people. AT: "You should not possess this land" or "You do not deserve this land." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: You have depended on your swords
tn.text: AT: "You have used your swords to get what you want."
AT: "done things that I hate very much"

tn.ref: each man defiles his neighbor's wife
tn.text: It is implied that they defile their neighbor's wives by sleeping with them.
Yahweh continues speaking to Ezekiel about the people who were living in the ruins of Israel.

See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:05:11|5:12]].

tn.ref: those in fortresses and in caves will die of plagues
tn.text: "plagues will kill the people who live in fortresses and caves"
A fortress is a building that people build to protect themselves from enemies who attack them.
Caves are natural holes in the side of a mountain or down in the ground. They are usually made of rock.
A "horror" is something that makes people very afraid when they see it. AT: "and people will be afraid because of it"

tn.ref: the pride of its might will end
tn.text: The word "it" refers to the land, which refers to the people of the land. Alternate translation: "the people of the land will not be proud anymore that they are strong." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: the mountains of Israel will be deserted
tn.text: "no one will lived in the mountains of Israel"

tn.ref: there will be no one to pass through them
tn.text: "there will be no one left to travel through the land or over the mountains"
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:06:06|6:7]].

tn.text: "all the things they have done that I hate"

tn.ref: Right words are in their mouths
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "Loving words are in their mouths" or 2) "Lustful words are in their mouths. AT: "With their mouths they say that they love me (UDB) or "With their mouths they talk about the things they lust after."

tn.ref: their hearts are going after unjust profit
tn.text: AT: "in their hearts they want to get their unjust profit" or "they want to get things in ways that are not just." They might do this my stealing things or tricking people.
Yahweh continues speaking to Ezekiel about the people of Israel.

tn.ref: you are like a lovely song to them
tn.text: AT: "they think that you are like a lovely song" or "they think that your words are like a lovely song"
Possible meanings are 1) "a beautiful song" or 2) "a love song" or "a song about love."

tn.ref: that is well played on a stringed instrument
tn.text: AT: "that someone plays very well on a stringed instrument." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
something that has strings and people use to make music
The word "this" refers to all of the things that had God said would happen and that Ezekiel told the people about.
The word "behold" here adds emphasis to what follows. AT: "indeed!"

tn.ref: that a prophet has been among them
tn.text: AT: "that I really sent you as a prophet."
